content:
The upper inset shows the acronym system used to name the hybrids. The lower inset shows the average dehydration temperatures for the 1D solids.

Materials Syntheses <bold>Mg-L-2-2-1D</bold>, <bold>Mg-L-2-0-1D</bold>, and <bold>Mg-L-0-0-3D</bold>

MgCl2·6H2O (4.39 mmol) was added to a solution formed by 1.0 mL of the ligand stock solution (4.39 mmol) and DI water (25 mL) under vigorous stirring. Solution pH was adjusted to the desired value (2, 2.7, 2.9, 3.2, and 3.3) with 5.0 or 1.0 M NaOH stock solutions. Mg-L-2-2-1D was obtained at pH = 2 while Mg-2-0-1D crystallized above pH 2.7. The clear, slightly yellow solutions were stored at RT. All reaction solutions precipitated microcrystalline materials after 3 days (yield 45%). If crystallization is maintained over 1 week, higher yields are obtained (70%). The precipitates were isolated by filtration (without washing) and air-dried. Anal. Calcd (%) for MgPC2O10H11 (Mg-L-2-2-1D): C, 9.59; H, 4.23. Found: C, 9.33; H, 3.48. Anal. Calcd (%) for MgPC2O8H7 (Mg-L-2-0-1D): C, 11.21; H, 3.29. Found: C, 10.44; H, 3.00. Mg-L-0-0-3D was prepared by heating Mg-L-2-2-1D at 270 °C for 3 h.

<bold>Zn-L-2-2-1D</bold>, <bold>Zn-L-2-0-1D</bold>, and <bold>Zn-L-0-0-3D</bold>

A synthetic procedure similar to that reported above for the analogous magnesium derivatives was used. For example, 0.2 mL of the HPAA stock solution (0.88 mmol) was reacted with ZnCl2 (0.88 mmol, 1:1 molar ratio) in 25 mL of DI water. Solution pH was adjusted to the desired value (2.5, 2.8, 3.1, and 3.3) with 5.0 or 1.0 M NaOH stock solutions. All reaction solutions precipitated crystalline material after 3 days at RT (yield 50%). Zn-L-2-2-1D was obtained as a single phase solid, at pH 2.5−2.8. Higher pH values (3.1 and 3.3) led to Zn-L-2-0-1D. If crystallization is allowed to proceed over 3 days, higher yields are obtained (∼ 60%). The precipitates were isolated by filtration and air-dried. Anal. Calcd (%) for ZnPC2O10H11 (Zn-L-2-2-1D): C, 8.24; H, 3.80. Found: C, 7.85; H, 2.35. Anal. Calcd (%) for ZnPC2O8H7 (Zn-L-2-0-1D): C, 9.40; H, 2.76. Found: C, 9.49; H, 2.77. Zn-L-0-0-3D was prepared by heating Zn-L-2-2-1D at 240 °C for 3 h.

<bold>Mg-L-2-0-2D</bold>

Mg(NO3)2·6H2O or MgO were separately reacted with a solution of the ligand and a fixed molar ratio Mg:L=1:1. A crystalline single phase compound was obtained in the pH range 2−3.2 adjusted by adding 1 M NaOH or 1 M HNO3. The reactions were maintained for 3 days at 180 °C. The resulting solids were filtered off, washed twice with DI water, and dried at 50 °C (yield 84%). Anal. Calcd (%) for MgPC2O8H7 (Mg-L-2-0-2D): C, 11.21; H, 3.29. Found: C, 10.53; H, 3.02.

<bold>Co-L-2-2-1D</bold>

A volume of the HPAA stock solution (2 mL, 8.78 mmol) was reacted with CoCl2 (8.78 mmol, 1:1 molar ratio) in DI water (250 mL). Solution pH was adjusted to 3.77 with 5.0 or 1.0 M NaOH stock solutions. The reaction solution precipitated microcrystalline material after 7 days at RT. Yield ∼ 70%.

<bold>Ni-L-2-1-1D</bold>

A volume of the HPAA stock solution (2 mL, 8.78 mmol) was reacted with NiCl2 (8.78 mmol, 1:1 molar ratio) in DI water (200 mL). Solution pH was adjusted to 2.0 with 5.0 or 1.0 M NaOH stock solutions. The reaction solution precipitated microcrystalline material after 7 days at RT. Yield ∼ 50%.

<bold>MgNa-L-0-0-3D</bold> and <bold>ZnK-L-0-0-3D</bold>

A variant of the synthesis procedure already described was followed. Hydrothermal reactions were conducted at 180 °C for 3 days. M/L molar ratios 1:1, 1:4 and 1:8 were assayed. The salts Zn(CH3COO)2·2H2O and Mg(CH3COO)2·4H2O were separately added to a solution formed by mixing together 0.5 mL of the HPAA stock solution (2.23 mmol), 0.5 mL of DI water, 0.78 mL of glacial acetic acid (14 mmol), and 14 mmol of sodium or potassium acetate. Final pH values were 5.1 (Zn2+ derivatives) and 4.4 (Mg2+ derivatives). For both series of materials, crystalline single phase solids were obtained using M/L 1:4 and 1:8 molar ratios. The resulting solids were filtered off, washed twice with DI water and then with acetone, and finally dried at 50 °C. The resulting yields for MgNa-L-0-0-3D and ZnK-L-0-0-3D were 95 and 68%, respectively. Anal. Calcd (%) for MgNaPC2O6H2 (MgNa-L-0-0-3D): C, 11.99; H, 1.01. Found: C, 10.88; H, 1.19. Anal. Calcd (%) for ZnKPC2O6H2 (ZnK-L-0-0-3D): C, 9.32; H, 0,78. Found: C, 8.87; H, 1.01.

Single phase compounds with 1D structures, M-L-2-2-1D (M = Mg, Co, Zn), can be isolated at RT at pH values lower than 2.7, 3.77, and 3.0, respectively. Syntheses at pH values slightly higher than those previously given yielded M-L-2-0-1D-type compounds. M-L-2-0-1D phases were also prepared by washing the corresponding M-L-2-2-1D compounds with DI water. As synthesized, the nickel derivative was a poorly crystalline solid. Its XRPD pattern shows only a few diffraction peaks, and it fits closely that of the copper derivative containing only one lattice water molecule, Cu-L-2-1-1D. The crystallinity of the nickel derivative was significantly improved by drying the sample at 60 °C. A Rietveld analysis of the pattern of this sample (see the ), using the structures of Cu-L-2-1-1D and Ni-L-2-0-1D as starting models gave a mixture of 36.5(4) wt % of Ni-L-2-1-1D and 63.5(1) wt % Ni-L-2-0-1D. On the other hand, the lattice water is very loosely held in Co-L-2-2-1D which rendered the determination of its precise crystal structure impossible. However, a Rietveld refinement from fast diffraction data, and refining only non-atomic parameters, confirmed that this phase is isostructural to that of Mg and Zn derivatives. The refined unit cell parameters of Co-L-2-2-1D were a = 8.596(1) Å, b = 8.597(1) Å, c = 21.845(2) Å, and V = 1834.0(5) Å3, in close agreement with those obtained for Mg and Zn compounds, see Table . The final Rietveld fit is shown in the . Powder pattern with large counting times for Co-L-2-2-1D invariably lead to partial dehydration of the compound during the measurement.

a The upper inset shows the acronym system used to name the hybrids. The lower inset shows the average dehydration temperatures for the 1D solids.  

Materials Syntheses

 Mg-L-2-2-1D, Mg-L-2-0-1D, and Mg-L-0-0-3D 

MgCl2⋅6H2O (4.39 mmol) was added to a solution formed by 1.0 mL of the ligand stock solution (4.39 mmol) and DI water (25 mL) under vigorous stirring. Solution pH was adjusted to the desired value (2, 2.7, 2.9, 3.2, and 3.3) with 5.0 or 1.0 M NaOH stock solutions. Mg-L-2-2-1D was obtained at pH = 2 while Mg-2-0-1D crystallized above pH 2.7. The clear, slightly yellow solutions were stored at RT. All reaction solutions precipitated microcrystalline materials after 3 days (yield 45%). If crystallization is maintained over 1 week, higher yields are obtained (70%). The precipitates were isolated by filtration (without washing) and air-dried. Anal. Calcd (%) for MgPC2O10H11 (Mg-L-2-2-1D): C, 9.59; H, 4.23. Found: C, 9.33; H, 3.48. Anal. Calcd (%) for MgPC2O8H7 (Mg-L-2-0-1D): C, 11.21; H, 3.29. Found: C, 10.44; H, 3.00. Mg-L-0-0-3D was prepared by heating Mg-L-2-2-1D at 270 °C for 3 h.

 Zn-L-2-2-1D, Zn-L-2-0-1D, and Zn-L-0-0-3D 

A synthetic procedure similar to that reported above for the analogous magnesium derivatives was used. For example, 0.2 mL of the HPAA stock solution (0.88 mmol) was reacted with ZnCl2 (0.88 mmol, 1:1 molar ratio) in 25 mL of DI water. Solution pH was adjusted to the desired value (2.5, 2.8, 3.1, and 3.3) with 5.0 or 1.0 M NaOH stock solutions. All reaction solutions precipitated crystalline material after 3 days at RT (yield 50%). Zn-L-2-2-1D was obtained as a single phase solid, at pH 2.5-2.8. Higher pH values (3.1 and 3.3) led to Zn-L-2-0-1D. If crystallization is allowed to proceed over 3 days, higher yields are obtained (~ 60%). The precipitates were isolated by filtration and air-dried. Anal. Calcd (%) for ZnPC2O10H11 (Zn-L-2-2-1D): C, 8.24; H, 3.80. Found: C, 7.85; H, 2.35. Anal. Calcd (%) for ZnPC2O8H7 (Zn-L-2-0-1D): C, 9.40; H, 2.76. Found: C, 9.49; H, 2.77. Zn-L-0-0-3D was prepared by heating Zn-L-2-2-1D at 240 °C for 3 h.

 Mg-L-2-0-2D 

Mg(NO3)2⋅6H2O or MgO were separately reacted with a solution of the ligand and a fixed molar ratio Mg:L=1:1. A crystalline single phase compound was obtained in the pH range 2-3.2 adjusted by adding 1 M NaOH or 1 M HNO3. The reactions were maintained for 3 days at 180 °C. The resulting solids were filtered off, washed twice with DI water, and dried at 50 °C (yield 84%). Anal. Calcd (%) for MgPC2O8H7 (Mg-L-2-0-2D): C, 11.21; H, 3.29. Found: C, 10.53; H, 3.02.

A volume of the HPAA stock solution (2 mL, 8.78 mmol) was reacted with CoCl2 (8.78 mmol, 1:1 molar ratio) in DI water (250 mL). Solution pH was adjusted to 3.77 with 5.0 or 1.0 M NaOH stock solutions. The reaction solution precipitated microcrystalline material after 7 days at RT. Yield ~ 70%.

 Ni-L-2-1-1D 

A volume of the HPAA stock solution (2 mL, 8.78 mmol) was reacted with NiCl2 (8.78 mmol, 1:1 molar ratio) in DI water (200 mL). Solution pH was adjusted to 2.0 with 5.0 or 1.0 M NaOH stock solutions. The reaction solution precipitated microcrystalline material after 7 days at RT. Yield ~ 50%.

 MgNa-L-0-0-3D and ZnK-L-0-0-3D 

A variant of the synthesis procedure already described was followed. Hydrothermal reactions were conducted at 180 °C for 3 days. M/L molar ratios 1:1, 1:4 and 1:8 were assayed. The salts Zn(CH3COO)2⋅2H2O and Mg(CH3COO)2⋅4H2O were separately added to a solution formed by mixing together 0.5 mL of the HPAA stock solution (2.23 mmol), 0.5 mL of DI water, 0.78 mL of glacial acetic acid (14 mmol), and 14 mmol of sodium or potassium acetate. Final pH values were 5.1 (Zn2+ derivatives) and 4.4 (Mg2+ derivatives). For both series of materials, crystalline single phase solids were obtained using M/L 1:4 and 1:8 molar ratios. The resulting solids were filtered off, washed twice with DI water and then with acetone, and finally dried at 50 °C. Calcd (%) for ZnKPC2O6H2 (ZnK-L-0-0-3D): C, 9.32; H, 0,78. Found: C, 8.87; H, 1.01.

Single phase compounds with 1D structures, M-L-2-2-1D (M = Mg, Co, Zn), can be isolated at RT at pH values lower than 2.7, 3.77, and 3.0, respectively. Syntheses at pH values slightly higher than those previously given yielded M-L-2-0-1D-type compounds. M-L-2-0-1D phases were also prepared by washing the corresponding M-L-2-2-1D compounds with DI water. As synthesized, the nickel derivative was a poorly crystalline solid. Its XRPD pattern shows only a few diffraction peaks, and it fits closely that of the copper derivative containing only one lattice water molecule, Cu-L-2-1-1D. The crystallinity of the nickel derivative was significantly improved by drying the sample at 60 °C. A Rietveld analysis of the pattern of this sample (see the ), using the structures of Cu-L-2-1-1D  and Ni-L-2-0-1D  as starting models gave a mixture of 36.5(4) wt % of Ni-L-2-1-1D and 63.5(1) wt % Ni-L-2-0-1D. On the other hand, the lattice water is very loosely held in Co-L-2-2-1D which rendered the determination of its precise crystal structure impossible. The final Rietveld fit is shown in the . Powder pattern with large counting times for Co-L-2-2-1D invariably lead to partial dehydration of the compound during the measurement.

data.yield: higher yields if crystallization is maintained over 1 week
higher yields if crystallization is allowed to proceed over 3 days
